title: Why not J4 support? (calling tank supp mains)
body:
I've played {{champion:59}} since God knows when and I love that champion to death. 

Recently, in light of all the tank support items and stoneborn pact, I've been trying {{champion:59}} support and it honestly feels pretty strong despite the weaker lv1 fight compared to other tank supports. His synergy with support items are just frigging amazing.

Let's first look at the kit.
His passive 
Allows for extra easy procs of relic shield and decent trades without building damage.

His q
shreds armor which is a direct buff to his and the adc's damage. Enables his combo which is the main form of cc

His w
God with the buff a few patches back, he scales amazingly with health. This also procs stone born pact constantly every few seconds and with a gargoyle Stoneplate and a locket, the Shields and heals and get pretty crazy.

The e
AS buff which is another buff to non caster adc's. Enables his combo

His ultimate
Probably one of the best things about him playing support. Enemies often underestimate the effectiveness of the wall in terms of peel and the nuke is also pretty good. This is frigging amazing if played with mf or jhin. Also helps junglers with long distance engages.

Item synergies
As j4 support, what you wan is mainly health and Shields to take advantage of your w, stoneborn pact and just inflicting buffs,debuffs and sticking like a flag in your enemies backs.

{{item:3109}}
Has absolutely everything j4 wants. Cdr, health, and the ability to stay near your adc, shielding away the damage they take.

{{item:3190}} 
By building health, locket in conjunction with your w and stone born part's bonus health, your Shields will just be massive

{{item:3193}} 
This is a must. Holy shit. This item just makes all of j4 supports aspects stronger. Stronger heal on stoneborn, strong w stronger everything

{{item:3050}} 
Now this is a new one. I've tried this with join and so far it's pretty decent. Not too set on it yet cuz it feels a bit weak. The passive plus his ultimate basically ensures that everyone gets ignited. But personally I prefer to use locket over this.

{{item:3071}} 
Not exactly  a support item but it helps with armor shred. Enchanter ish and MOAR CDR

{{item:3068}} 
Edited in: totally forgot about this. This one is just a j4 thing. Its frigging amazing due to his r trapping people with you in your sunfire cape range and just having decent tank stats in general. This in conjunction with zeke's convergence also makes you this sort of passive aoe damage storm. However, the trade off is less support items.

Playstyle 
So far from the games I've experimented with, you basically play as a tank support buff bot. Massive Shields and armor shreds plus AS buffs, constant knock ups with the soft cc on the ultimate and pretty decent roam potential. 
However his early game seems a tad bit weaker than other tank supports due to him requiring scaling to truly succeed.
(also, i add 3 points in e followed by r>w>e>q for bigger shields and shorter cooldowns on e. the cool down on e is slightly longer than that of q. adding e brings the gap closer.)

Edit: Pointers from discussions so far

Basically, there are supports who do similar things (namely: {{champion:89}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:111}} )
Defensive steroid in lane not up to par with tank supports
mechanically more demanding compared to above mentioned supports.

All in all, he seems like a decent support. Tank support mains, any thoughts?

Yea. Works pretty well supporting vayne too
Actually not as good as you think, unless you actually lock her in with you which is also not a good thing usually. Her range is the problem.
She can condemn someone caught by Jarvan from the outside though, couldn't she? The actual ultimate only has like a 300-unit radius terrain formation, it shouldn't be a problem.

In a lane fight, enemies caught by the ult tend to be running back to turret. Positions are usually:

T --------- Enemies-----------J4-----------Vayne

Going from that, they will usually be at the edge of the wall, barely out of range, facing turret and Vayne actually has to travel around the wall a bit to get to a point she can fire E.

But if the fight was in favour of J4, he could lock Vayne with tht enemy and there would be no problem if the support isnt a dangerous cc machine.

So if Vayne is outside, she has to walk a little bit to the left.

And since they're chasing, she's probably gonna do that anyway.

So no problem then.

Gotcha.

Time is a matter of great consequence when fighting the enemy.  Every second that Vayne spends running around and not attacking is time spent in a 1v2.  It's also time for the enemy mid or jungler to arrive or just basic abilities to come off cooldown.

*ahem* "Gotcha."

She literally just has to get 50 units closer to auto-attack someone, and her condemn has a target radius of around 700 units.

She shouldn't need to be inside of Jarvan's ulti to even Condemn, and she can easily just Q to close the supposed gap that would interfere with her dps while they're stunned.

Jarvan really is not only  great support but one of (if not THE) most versatile champs in the game.  He can do well in Literally! every lane.   He can top, he can mid, he can jungle(his first clear is a bit of a challenge and he'll be weaker 1v1 early on against most other junglers, but after his scaling and items kicks in he can turn into a monster) he can support.  He can be built bruiser, full tank, or even assassin.  

Really he should be the considered THE best support as support is meant to help and the best thing Jarvan does is "help".

J4 is in general strong right now, so that might be biasing his results in off-roles.

That said, I'm broadly a sup main, and I feel like he's probably ok as an off-meta support pick, particularly if you happen to be good at j4. Don't expect he'd really fit as a meta pick, as theres plenty of other tank supports that offer more lockdown potential.

Would have concerns with his ability to peel, particularly if you fall behind at all, since his cc involves gap closing through enemies, which is prone to leaving you in a bad spot. Alternatively you use eq to escape, but then your adc is kinda left to the wolves.

Possible support budget concerns.

Yea. My thoughts too about the gold budget and about j4 just being strong. Then again, j4 is really commonly played In his off role (j4 wasn't designed as a jungle) so you could say he was always strong in his off roles.

I have to agree about the part that other tank supports offer more lockdown. But what about the other utilities j4 bring? Mainly talking about armor shred, attack speed and high Base damage. Would that not cover some of those weaknesses?

Attack speed isn't really that much (compare to say, nunu blood boil), and many more meta supports end up granting AS through ardent censer. 

He is melee, so he won't get to use his passive all that often except when essentially going all in with eq and/or ult, and then you're in trouble if an enemy jg is lurking, so most of his damage is just going to be from q, which as a single ability isn't bringing that much damage to the table compared to stuff like brand. Even the aforementioned nunu has more base damage on his Q (which also slows and slows AS too).

Armour shred is neat and all, but it's % shred, which isn't really that potent against squishy targets (such as the enemy adc) compared to flat pen, and also only lasts 3 seconds, which in early game will only amount to 2-3 autos that benefit. 

You're also not going to be able to reap all the potential benefits of the kit at the same time. If you're using your flag for the AS proactively, then it's not going to be useful for an eq gapclose (assuming enemy don't position poorly), and similarly if you're trading with q it could be on cd when you want it.

It's unclear what you want to be maxing as j4 support too, as all of them do enhanced support-y things when leveled, when plenty of other supports get almost their full benefit even at rank 1.

Also, all of those features are offensive perks, which is all well and good if you happen to be winning lane, but if you're behind, then you're kinda useless. I'd think you(/your duo partner) would be pretty susceptible to ganks too, so if the enemy jungler agrees, then you could be in for a rough time.

Like I said though, I could see it working better than plenty of other off-meta supports since all his abilities do have something support-y to offer, but I just don't see it being as effective as more conventional picks

It is up to the user how to use the kit. A particular peel that works when behind is R, EQ out and W if still being chased. The AS buff will always be there when it is needed, because chances are that when you need it, you will be doing a EQ anyway. 

Peeling when behind involves staying behind a little, then EQ forwards, getting the knockup off while also starting the escape at the same time. Or as mentioned earlier, REQ.

the thing with J4 compared to a Leona is with the sort of reliability of his ult. you can miss a Leona ult. You can't miss a J4 ult, so it is guaranteed to burn an escape. granted, it is not a 100% lock as it is not exactly a CC but it works loosely like a root in a way for any aoe based adc like mf to unload their entire kits on the enemy. Compared to Naut, he has more mobility to get to the enemy he needs and a more reliable way too (his EQ passes through minions and his R is targetted). However, he does lack in "hard" CC although his ult is arguably a kind of CC too.

What J4 really has over Naut though, is damage coming from his base values and more damage in the form of armor debuffing and the AS buff for his ADC. As a J4 support, I mentioned you have to be actively looking for kills in the lane or you are just playing an inferior version of the other supports like you said.
In addition, the w becomes much better in team fight, much lower cooldowns, and generally just more versatile while being weaker only in the straight up tank fight

I have played some Jarvan support over the years. He has too many problems - Mana, gets poked, pushes the wave when using his poke, falls off super hard without building AD and the enemy team can ignore you. 
Maybe if RITO changes the tank items, he would be more viable, but then why not play Nautilus or something else as tanks support?
If you are after playing bruiser as a support, Pantheon is way better, because he will kill the enemy support (if it is janna, lulu etc) or the ADC, if the support is tanky, at lvl 3 and snowball your ADC.  You also need ignite. 
Pantheon is the only troll support that used to consistently take the tier 3 tower or inhibs years ago before all the snowballing changes in my games. He is pretty good, but also falls off, so you stomp, or get stomped.
GP support was also pretty good pre-rework.
He is decent precisely of the recent tank support items changes. J4 support back then would have totally sucked due to the above problems.

I encourage all J4 Players to try this out if they are interested in playing support but don't like the current tank support choice. 
For tank support mains, if you are bored, could look into this but playing support j4 is going to definitely be more challenging to play than other tank supports.
I'd also add Banner of Command. It's a nice armor/MR item with CDR, and a speed boost, not to mention some great tower pushing.

That being said I think I might try him with Frozen Mallet as I've done with Shen support and see if that is good enough for peel as well.
